channel.title: Awk on ZeroToOne
channel.description: Recent content in Awk on ZeroToOne

item.title: Practical AWK
item.description: Sometimes, we need to run a series of commands or API calls, gather their outputs, and store them in an organized way. For example, imagine we have a CSV file and want to use multiple cURL commands to fetch information about the data in it. Then, we might need to clean up and format the results from each step and use them as inputs for other cURL calls or commands. In this article, I’ll show how to handle these real-life scenarios using a powerful tool called AWK.
